pylovo

  • Javascript API Reference
  • Urbs Results
  • setup_urbs_results.js
  • View page source

setup_urbs_results.js

SetupUrbsResultEditor()

retrieve network data and setup editor

displayUrbsNet(ppdata)

aggregate function calling the actual functions that place the feature sgeojsons on the leaflet map

Arguments:

  • ppdata (dict) – grid data

addUrbsGeoJSONtoMap(isLines, input_geoJSON, featureName)

function that adds a FeatureCollection to the leaflet map we set styles and onclick functions here and save references to each added feature in the NetworkObject lines (lines, trafos) and circlemarkers (buses, ext_grids) need to be handled differently because lines do not have the pointToLayer function

Arguments:

  • isLines (boolean) –

  • input_geoJSON (geoJSON_FeatureCollection) –

  • featureName (string) –

populateUrbsResultsLoadBusLists(htmlListName)
Arguments:

  • htmlListName (string) – name of the html select element that is supposed to be filled with the buses with attached loads

openUrbsNetworkList(e, listName)

gets called when one of the tablink buttons in the GUI gets pressed and opens the relevant feature list, while hiding all other GUI elements editors are closed, lists are hidden, buttons are set to inactive

Arguments:

  • e (event) – event that triggered the function call

  • listName (string) – name of the element to be opened

fillSelectedUrbsNetworkFeatureEditor(sel, listName)

onchange method for the feature lists in the GUI window picks the corresponding map object for the selected list element to execute the clickonmarker function on

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_object) – reference to the select element that just changed

  • listName (string) – key for NetworkObject list

resetUrbsStyle(target, feature)

resets the style of the previously selected feature

Arguments:

  • target (HTML_element) – the map object whose style we want to change

  • feature (string) – the name of the map object type

clickOnUrbsMarker(target, feature)

When clicking on a map element or making a selection from a list, we highlight the relevant element, open the Editor window and fill its input fields with the relevant values

Arguments:

  • target (HTML_element) – the object that has been interacted with on the map. Null in case we have clicked on a list element

  • feature (string) – key for accessing f.e. featurelist in the NetworkObject

getPlotOfFeature(feature, targetName)

sends the feature type and the name of the feature we want to generate a plot for to the backend

Arguments:

  • feature (string) – to distinguish what type of plot we want to generate in the backend

  • targetName (string) – key needed to access data for a specific site in the hdf5 file

setInnerHTML(elm, html)

makes sure inline script is executed once we add a plot to the GUI, which makes the plot visible and interactible from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2592092/executing-script-elements-inserted-with-innerhtml

Arguments:

  • elm (HTML_element) – html div element we want to add the plot to

  • html (*) – html code we want to add to the div
